name: Analytics Spam Blocker
author: Arnan de Gans

sections.description:
For any website or business owner, having Matomo Analytics, Google Analytics and similar services are a vital tool to track your website performance. Unfortunately there are spam bots from many shady organizations that bounce off your website and give you false records in your analytics – This is called referral spam or more commonly referrer spam. Analytics Spam Blocker prevents referrer spam from ever reaching your website by blocking them at the server level leaving your analytics untouched. Easily report new domains you find to our free API for regular updates of the blocklist. Stop those sites from affecting anyones website analytics today!

Help make Analytics Spam Blocker better and report referrer spam domains via the reporting tool in Analytics Spam Blocker, you can access the dashboard page in the Tools menu of the WordPress dashboard.
sections.installation:
1. Navigate to Plugins > Add New in your dashboard.
  2. Search for ‘Arnan’ in the plugin database and click install on the ‘Analytics Spam Blocker’ plugin.
  3. Once installed activate the plugin and you’re ready to go.
  4. Navigate to Tools > Analytics Spam Blocker in your dashboard to make reports.
sections.faq:
How does this work?

Analytics Spam Blocker adds a list of domains to be blocked to your .htaccess file. This list is regularly updated next to what you add yourself so you’ll be able to filter out the majority of referrer spam very quickly.

Why do I need a subscription?

You don’t, older versions required a free subscribtion though. Update to version 3 or newer to see the new system.

How does the list get updated?

I’ve developed a unique reporting system where you can easily report suspicious domains. If the domain gets reported a few times by different people it will be included in the blocklist.

Who manages the blocklist updates?

In a way, you do. By reporting new domains. However the system is mostly automated after you send your report. The blocklist service is governed and provided by Arnan de Gans.

I need help with this plugin

Check out the Support Forum.

This is cool, do you have more plugins?

Yep, check out my website AJdG Solutions.

sections.reviews:
Works well

By (sloweye) on June 1, 2020

This works much better than trying to maintain and update my own filter list in Google Analytics.

Good but can be improved

By mborin on November 30, 2018

There needs to be a way for users to add domains to the list of blocked domains.

UPDATE: Deleted Analytics Spam Blocker

By donhz on May 4, 2022

Wait for 7 days then check your Referrers for that time people. Spam will be gone for that 7 days. This is to say the old bad Referrers don't go away. But new ones are blocked as they should be. EDIT*** Lowered my rating. Regardless of how good or bad the plug-in may be, these developers insist on putting big beg notices on the Admin page. This is a rookie marketing error on their part. I have deleted the plug-in to get rid of their trash. Analytics Spam Blocker continued to beg for a review (even though I reviewed it before), and this is it. I think your Admin page noitces doom you to failure.

Great plugin

By DawneR on July 28, 2018

This is a great plugin that has really helped me ensure that my GA stats are real. I've recently started blogging, and I was really excited to see my pageviews go way up in one day, until I realized it was almost all fake. :( As soon as I installed Analytics Spam Blocker, my stats went back to normal. The plugin was easy to install and I had no issues.

Needs improvements

By (wvdploeg) on July 27, 2017

Works fairly well, but it needs some improvements. Modern Referral spam bots often use 'look alike characters' in domain names, characters from non-western alphabets resembling western characters. The function to report a spam domain however tells that the 'domain name is not valid'. Like for example ḷ.com...

No Good

By Jeff Rudd on October 14, 2016

I found it completely useless in getting rid of www1.free-share-buttons.top

This plugin is giving out an error msg ''Website Loading Terminated.''

By M-Dubbs (Miiz) on September 3, 2016

Hi.

Not sure why this is happening but after I activate this plugin my site becomes unreachable with error msg ''Website Loading Terminated.'' - When I deactivate this plugin it goes away. Any idea whats going on?

short_description: Prevent referrer spam from affecting your website analytics. Easily create a local blocklist and report new domains to stay on top of the issue.
